intro: Caamembeca amazonensis, commonly known as the Amazonian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical regions.
